enums.name: ErrorReason
enums.description:
Represents the reason for an error, providing a unique
constant value for the error.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_UNSPECIFIED
values.description:
ERROR_REASON_UNSPECIFIED indicates that no specific error reason
has been specified.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INTERNAL
values.description: An internal error, this happens in case of unexpected condition or failure within the service

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_CREDENTIAL_ENVELOPE_TYPE
values.description:
The credential envelope type is invalid. For valid values refer to
the enum CredentialEnvelopeType.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_CREDENTIAL_ENVELOPE_VALUE_FORMAT
values.description:
The credential envelope value format does not correspond to the format
specified in envelope_type.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_ISSUER
values.description: The issuer contains one or more invalid fields.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_ISSUER_NOT_REGISTERED
values.description: The issuer is not registered in the Node.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_VERIFIABLE_CREDENTIAL
values.description:
The Verifiable Credential is invalid, this can be related to either
invalid format or unable to verify the Data Integrity proof.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_IDP_REQUIRED
values.description: An issuer is required to have an external IdP

values.name: ERROR_REASON_UNSUPPORTED_PROOF
values.description: The proof type is not supported

values.name: ERROR_REASON_RESOLVER_METADATA_NOT_FOUND
values.description: Unable to resolve an ID to a ResolverMetadata

values.name: ERROR_REASON_ID_ALREADY_REGISTERED
values.description: The ID and Resolver Metadata are already registered in the system

messages.name: ErrorInfo
messages.description: Describes the cause of the error with structured details.

fields.name: reason
fields.description:
The reason of the error, as defined by the ErrorReason enum.
This is a constant unique value that helps identify the cause of
the error.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: message
fields.description:
The message describing the error in a human-readable way. This
field gives additional details about the error.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Jwk
messages.description:
JWK represents:
- a JSON Web Key (JWK) with the respective fields specific to RSA algorithms.
- a Quantum JSON Web Key (QJWK) with the respective fields specific to AKP algorithms.

fields.name: alg
fields.description:
ALG represents the algorithm intended for use with the key.
Example algorithms for Post-Quantum ML-DSA family:
"ML-DSA-44", "ML-DSA-65", "ML-DSA-87".
Some example algorithms are "RS256", "RS384", "RS512" for RSA algorithms.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: kty
fields.description:
KTY represents the key type parameter.
It specifies the family of quantum algorithms used with the key,
such as "AKP" for post quantum algorithms
or "RSA" for non quantum algorithms.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: use
fields.description:
Use represents the intended use of the key.
Some example values are "enc" and "sig".
fields.label: optional

fields.name: kid
fields.description:
KID represents the key ID.
It is used to match a specific key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pub
fields.description: The public key for the AKP kty.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: priv
fields.description: The private key for the AKP kty.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: seed
fields.description: Seed used to derive keys for ML-DSA alg.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: e
fields.description: The exponent for the RSA public key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: n
fields.description: The modulus for the RSA public key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: d
fields.description: The private exponent for the RSA kty.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: p
fields.description: The first prime factor for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: q
fields.description: The second prime factor for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: dp
fields.description: The first factor CRT exponent for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: dq
fields.description: The second factor CRT exponent for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: qi
fields.description: The first CRT coefficient for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Jwks
messages.description: JWKS represents a set of JSON Web Keys (JWKs).

fields.name: keys
fields.description: Keys represents the list of JSON Web Keys.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: ResolverMetadata
messages.description:
ResolverMetadata represents a set of data describing the ID including mechanisms such as:
  - cryptographic public keys - used to authenticate itself and prove
    association with the ID
  - service - ways of communicating with the node that published the document

A ResolverMetadata can be retrieved by resolving an ID.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The ID
The metadata below is related as claims to the ID
fields.label: optional

fields.name: verification_method
fields.description:
VerificationMethod is a list of cryptographic public keys, which can be used
to authenticate or authorize interactions with the entities represented by the ID.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: service
fields.description:
Service is used in ResolverMetadatas to express ways of communicating with
the node that published the document.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: assertion_method
fields.description:
AssertionMethod is used to specify how the entity represented by the ID
is expected to express claims, such as for the purposes of issuing a VCs.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Service
messages.description:
Service is used in ResolverMetadata to express ways of communicating with
the node that published the document.

fields.name: service_endpoint
fields.description:
ServiceEndpoint is a network address, such as an HTTP URL, of the
node.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: VerificationMethod
messages.description:
VerificationMethod expresses verification methods, such as cryptographic
public keys, which can be used to authenticate or authorize interactions
with the entities represented by the ID. It is a part of the ResolverMetadata.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique id of the verification method.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: public_key_jwk
fields.description: The public key used for the verification method.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Issuer
messages.description: A Identity Issuer

fields.name: organization
fields.description: The organization of the issuer
fields.label: optional

fields.name: sub_organization
fields.description: The sub organization of the issuer
fields.label: optional

fields.name: common_name
fields.description:
The common name of the issuer
Could be a FQDN or a FQDA
fields.label: optional

fields.name: public_key
fields.description:
This field is optional
The keys of the issuer in JWK format
The public key is used to verify the signature of the different claims
fields.label: optional

fields.name: private_key
fields.description:
This field is optional
The private key of the issuer in JWK format
fields.label: optional

messages.name: McpResource
messages.description:
McpResource represents a resource available on the MCP server.
This can be a file, a database, or any other type of resource.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the resource.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the resource.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: uri
fields.description: URI of the resource.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: McpServer
messages.description:
McpServer represents an MCP server that provides a set of tools and resources
The server needs to be deployed at a specific URL

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the server.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: url
fields.description: Url of the deployed server.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: tools
fields.description: The tools available on the server.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: resources
fields.description: The resources available on the server.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: McpTool
messages.description:
McpTool represents a tool available on the MCP server.
This can be a function with name, description, and parameters.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the tool.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the tool.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: parameters
fields.description:
Parameters of the tool.
This is a JSON object that describes the parameters
fields.label: optional

fields.name: oauth2_metadata
fields.description:
Oauth2 Protected Resource metadata.
This will correspond to a resource on the server.
Or can be specified or overridden by the auth policies.
This complies with RFC 9728.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Oauth2Metadata
messages.description:
Oauth2Metadata represents the OAuth2 metadata for a protected resource.
This complies with RFC 9728.

fields.name: resource
fields.description: The resource identifier.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: authorization_servers
fields.description:
Authorization servers for the OAuth2 server.
This is a list of strings, such as "https://example.com/oauth2/authorize".
fields.label: optional

fields.name: bearer_methods_supported
fields.description:
Bearer methods supported
This is a list of strings, such as "client_credentials" or "authorization_code".
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: scopes_supported
fields.description:
Scopes supported
This is a list of strings, such as "openid" or "profile".
fields.label: repeated

enums.name: CredentialContentType
enums.description:
The content of the Credential.
Multiple content types can be supported: AgentBadge, etc.

values.name: CREDENTIAL_CONTENT_TYPE_AGENT_BADGE
values.description:
AgentBadge Content Type.
The Agent content representation following a defined schema
OASF: https://schema.oasf.agntcy.org/schema/objects/agent
Google A2A: https://github.com/google/A2A/blob/main/specification/json/a2a.json

values.name: CREDENTIAL_CONTENT_TYPE_MCP_BADGE
values.description:
McpBadge Content Type.
The MCP content representation following a defined schema
The schema is defined in the MCP specification as the MCPServer type

enums.name: CredentialEnvelopeType
enums.description:
The Envelope Type of the Credential.
Multiple envelope types can be supported: Embedded Proof, JOSE, COSE etc.

messages.name: BadgeClaims
messages.description:
BadgeClaims represents the content of a Badge VC defined [here]

[here]: https://spec.identity.agntcy.org/docs/vc/intro/

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The ID as defined [here]

[here]: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#credential-subject
fields.label: optional

fields.name: badge
fields.description: The content of the badge
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CredentialContent
messages.description: CredentialContent represents the content of a Verifiable Credential.

fields.name: content_type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the content of the credential.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: content
fields.description: The content representation in JSON-LD format.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CredentialSchema
messages.description:
CredentialSchema represents the credentialSchema property of a Verifiable Credential.
more information can be found [here]

[here]: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model-2.0/#data-schemas

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the file
fields.label: optional

fields.name: id
fields.description: The URL identifying the schema file
fields.label: optional

messages.name: EnvelopedCredential
messages.description: EnvelopedCredential represents a Credential enveloped in a specific format.

fields.name: envelope_type
fields.description: EnvelopeType specifies the type of the envelope used to store the credential.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value is the enveloped credential in the specified format.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Proof
messages.description:
A data integrity proof provides information about the proof mechanism,
parameters required to verify that proof, and the proof value itself.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the proof
fields.label: optional

fields.name: proof_purpose
fields.description: The proof purpose
fields.label: optional

fields.name: proof_value
fields.description: The proof value
fields.label: optional

messages.name: VerifiableCredential
messages.description:
DataModel represents the W3C Verifiable Credential Data Model defined [here]

[here]: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/

fields.name: context
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#contexts
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: type
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#dfn-type
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#issuer
fields.label: optional

fields.name: content
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#credential-subject
fields.label: optional

fields.name: id
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#identifiers
fields.label: optional

fields.name: issuance_date
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#issuance-date
fields.label: optional

fields.name: expiration_date
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#expiration
fields.label: optional

fields.name: credential_schema
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model-2.0/#data-schemas
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: proof
fields.description: https://w3id.org/security#proof
fields.label: optional

messages.name: VerifiablePresentation
messages.description:
DataModel represents the W3C Verifiable Presentation Data Model defined [here]

[here]: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/

fields.name: context
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#contexts
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: type
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#dfn-type
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: verifiable_credential
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials#verifiableCredential
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: proof
fields.description: https://w3id.org/security#proof
fields.label: optional

messages.name: IssueVCRequest
messages.description: Issues a Verifiable Credential in a specific Envelope Type

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID is the identifier.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content of the VC

fields.name: envelope_type
fields.description: Envelope type

messages.name: IssueVCResponse
messages.description: Returns the Verifiable Credential in the requested Envelope Type

fields.name: vc
fields.description: The issued VC

messages.name: KeyGenResponse
messages.description: Returns the generated keypair in Json Web Key (JWK) format

fields.name: keypair
fields.description: The generated keypair

services.name: LocalService
services.description: LocalService is the service that provides LOCAL issuer operations.

methods.name: KeyGen
methods.description: Generate a keypair in Json Web Key (JWK) format

methods.name: IssueVC
methods.description: Issue a Verifiable Credential in a specific Envelope Type

messages.name: GenerateRequest
messages.description:
Generate an Id and its corresponding ResolverMetadata for the specified Issuer
For external IdPs, the Issuer should be provided with a Proof of ownership
of the Issuer's provided id

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: The Issuer details

fields.name: proof
fields.description:
Optional Proof of ownership of the Issuer's provided id
This should be provided when the Issuer is provided by an external IdP
Example: a signed JWT
fields.label: optional

messages.name: GenerateResponse
messages.description: Returns the Generated Id and its corresponding ResolverMetadata

fields.name: resolver_metadata
fields.description: The ResolverMetadata corresponding to the generated Id

messages.name: ResolveRequest
messages.description: Resolve a specified Id to its corresponding ResolverMetadata

fields.name: id
fields.description: Id is the identifier.

messages.name: ResolveResponse
messages.description: Returns the ResolverMetadata corresponding to the specified Id

fields.name: resolver_metadata
fields.description: The ResolverMetadata resolved from the Id

services.name: IdService
services.description: IdService is the service that provides ID operations.

methods.name: Generate
methods.description: Generate an Id and its corresponding ResolverMetadata for the specified Issuer

methods.name: Resolve
methods.description: Resolve a specified Id to its corresponding ResolverMetadata

messages.name: GetIssuerWellKnownRequest
messages.description: Request to get the well-known JWKS document of an issuer

fields.name: common_name
fields.description: The common name of the issuer

messages.name: GetIssuerWellKnownResponse
messages.description: Returns the content of the well-known JWKS document

fields.name: jwks
fields.description: The well-known Json Web Key Set (JWKS) document

messages.name: RegisterIssuerRequest
messages.description: Request to register an issuer

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: The Issuer to register.

fields.name: proof
fields.description:
Optional Proof of ownership of the Issuer's common_name
This should be provided when the Issuer is provided by an external IdP
Example: a signed JWT
fields.label: optional

messages.name: RegisterIssuerResponse
messages.description: Returns the action to take to complete the registration

fields.name: uri
fields.description:
Optional: a uri indicating an action to take to complete the registration
Depending on the issuer type, this could be a validation URL
fields.label: optional

services.name: IssuerService
services.description: IssuerService is the service that provides ISSUER node operations.

methods.name: Register
methods.description: Register an issuer by providing the issuer details

methods.name: GetWellKnown
methods.description:
Returns the well-known document content for an issuer in
Json Web Key Set (JWKS) format

messages.name: GetVcWellKnownRequest
messages.description: Requests the well-known VCs for an Id

fields.name: id
fields.description: The identifier.

messages.name: GetVcWellKnownResponse
messages.description: Returns the well-known VCs for an Id

fields.name: vcs
fields.description: The list of VCs for the specified Id
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: PublishRequest
messages.description: Request to publish an issued Verifiable Credential

fields.name: vc
fields.description: The Verifiable Credential to publish

fields.name: proof
fields.description:
Optional Proof of ownership of the Issuer's ResolverMetadata
This should be provided when the Issuer is provided by an external IdP
Example: a signed JWT
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SearchRequest
messages.description: Request to search for VCs based on the specified criteria

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID is the identifier.

fields.name: schema
fields.description: Schema is the schema of the credential contained in the VC

fields.name: content
fields.description: The credential content representation in JSON-LD format

messages.name: SearchResponse
messages.description: Returns the VCs that match the search criteria

fields.name: vcs
fields.description: The list of VCs that match the search criteria
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: VerifyRequest
messages.description: Request to verify an existing Verifiable Credential

fields.name: vc
fields.description: The Verifiable Credential to verify

services.name: VcService
services.description: VC is the service that provides VC operations.

methods.name: GetWellKnown
methods.description: Returns the well-known Verifiable Credentials for the specified Id

methods.name: Search
methods.description: Search for Verifiable Credentials based on the specified criteria

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
